Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

JPL’s Quality Assurance (QA) organization is seeking to hire the first ever QA Apprentice. JPL QA collaborates with all organizations that design, build, assemble, test, deliver, and operate unprecedented space and Earth science missions in support of NASA's vision. We are a world-class organization with highly skilled and motivated people that minimize project risk by ensuring hardware and software is built as intended. We demonstrate technical excellence in QA throughout the project lifecycle. QA is responsible for ensuring JPL products work, even when they are millions of miles away.

The QA Apprentice program is intended to create a pathway towards a career in QA. This unique full-time, temporary opportunity provides the employee a thorough set of training including quality assurance principles, requirements, best practices, as well as hands-on experience with JPL flight hardware. They will then perform inspection of electronic, mechanical, and raw materials beginning in Receiving Inspection. There will also be opportunities to have rotations within Electronic and Mechanical Inspection areas.

This position will be responsible for performing the dimensional and/or electrical inspection of parts procured from JPL suppliers for spacecraft assembly. The ideal candidate will inspect mechanical or electronics components, subassemblies and assemblies using a wide range of inspection tools and equipment such as micrometers, thread gages, height gages, optical comparators, and electrical test equipment. Additional responsibilities include ensuring parts meet defined requirements and reporting of non-conformances.

This position will require working with customers to understand and sometimes suggest inspection requirements, and documenting/communicating inspection results. Inspectors collaborate with all organizations that design, build, assemble, test, deliver, and operate unprecedented space missions in support of NASA's vision. The apprenticeship program will include the following areas of instruction and hands- experience within the first year:

  • Quality Assurance Principles
  • Drawing and Requirement Interpretation
  • Receiving Inspection (Hands-On)
  • Mechanical and Electrical Parts Inspection (Hands-On)
  • Nonconformance Reporting
  • Process Improvement
  • Corrective and Preventive Action
  • Process Improvement techniques
  • Introduction to all aspects of QA including, Procurement QA, Receiving Inspection, Mechanical Inspection, Electrical Inspection, Hardware QA, and Software QA

Qualifications:

  • Requires a High School diploma
  • Ability to communicate well in verbal and written correspondence
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Self-sufficient and highly motivated with ability to learn through self-study, web-based training, and on-the-job training
  • Desire to be a part of JPL Missions
  • Must be able to work full-time, 40 hrs/week (9/80 work schedule)
  • Demonstrated ability to use computer programs such as Microsoft Office Products
  • Experience with writing papers and reports
  • Experience working in groups

Desired but not required qualifications include:

  • Enrollment in Associate's Degree program with progress towards completion
  • Skilled at technical writing
  • Problem solving skills

Note: As a temporary position, this assignment may last up to 36 months in duration with approvals based on 12-month assignments.  However, please note that you are not under any employment contract and your temporary employment status can be terminated at any time, with or without notice.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.
